00025 void indnt_inc(){
00026    indent_counter++;
00027    isp[indent_counter] = '\0';
00028    isp[indent_counter-1] = ' ';
00029 }

00031 void indnt_dec(){
00032    indent_counter--;
00033    isp[indent_counter+1] = ' ';

00039 /// finds integer (32bit) elements in a set (n elements) and returns indices - only one (the first) match
00040 /// is reported per element
00041 /// a vector "matches" of length n_elements has to be provided
00042 void pmatchi(long* elements, long* n_elements, long* set, long* n_set, long* matches){
00043         long    i;
00044         for (i = 0; i < *n_elements; i++){
00045                 matches[i] = 0;
00046 
00047                 while ((set[matches[i]] != elements[i]) && (matches[i] < *n_set))
00048                 {
00049                         matches[i]++;
00050                 }
00051 
00052                 if (matches[i] == *n_set) {matches[i] = -1;}
00053         }
00054 }
00055 
00056 /// finds character elements in a set (n elements) and returns indices - only one (the first) match
00057 /// is reported per element
00058 /// a vector "matches" of length n_elements has to be provided
00059 void pmatchc(char** elements, long* n_elements, char** set, long* n_set, long* matches){
00060 
00061         long    i;
00062         for (i = 0; i < *n_elements; i++){
00063                 matches[i] = 0;
00064 
00065                 while ((strcmp( set[matches[i]], elements[i]) != 0) && (matches[i] < *n_set))
00066                 {
00067                         matches[i]++;
00068                 }
00069 
00070                 if (matches[i] == *n_set) {matches[i] = -1;}
00071         }
00072 }
00073 
00074 // finds a character element in a set and returns boolean match vector
00075 // a vector "matches" of length n_set has to be provided
00076 void matchc(char* element, char** set, long* n_set, bool* matches){
00077 
00078         long    i;
00079         for (i = 0; i < *n_set; i++){
00080                 if(strcmp(element, set[i])==0){
00081                         matches[i]      = true;}
00082                 else{
00083                         matches[i]      = false;}
00084         }
00085 }
00086 
00087 // finds a integer element in a set and returns boolean match vector
00088 // a vector "matches" of length n_set has to be provided
00089 void matchi(long* element, long* set, long* n_set, bool* matches){
00090 
00091         long    i;
00092         for (i = 0; i < *n_set; i++){
00093                 if(*element == set[i]){
00094                         matches[i]      = true;}
00095                 else{
00096                         matches[i]      = false;}
00097         }
00098 }

00101 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00102 // interpolation on a table: code (w/ adapted indices) from Numerical Recipes, 2rd ed., chapter 3.1
00103 // added wrapping function interp which allows to chose degree of interpolation polynomial
00104 // (1 = linear, 2 = quadratic, etc.)
00105 void locate(float* xx, long* n, float* x, long* j)
00106 {
00107         long    ju, jm, jl;
00108         int             ascnd;
00109 
00110         jl              =       0;
00111         ju              =       *n + 1;
00112         ascnd   =       (xx[*n-1] >= xx[1-1]);
00113         while (ju - jl > 1){
00114                 jm              =       (ju + jl) >> 1;
00115                 if (*x >= xx[jm-1] == ascnd)
00116                         jl      =       jm;
00117                 else
00118                         ju      =       jm;
00119         }
00120         if ( *x == xx[1 - 1]) *j = 1;
00121         else if (*x == xx[*n - 1]) *j = *n - 1;
00122         else *j =       jl;
00123         return;
00124 }
00125 
00126 void polint(float* xa, float* ya, long* n, float* x, float *y, float *dy)
00127 {
00128         long    i, m, ns=1;
00129         float   den, dif, dift, ho, hp, w;
00130         float   *c,*d;
00131 
00132         dif             =       (float)fabs(*x-xa[1-1]);
00133         c               =       (float*)calloc(*n, sizeof(float));
00134         d               =       (float*)calloc(*n, sizeof(float));
00135         for (i = 1; i <= *n; i++) {
00136                 if ( (dift = (float)fabs(*x - xa[i-1])) < dif) {
00137                         ns              =       i;
00138                         dif             =       dift;
00139                 }
00140                 c[i-1]  =       ya[i-1];
00141                 d[i-1]  =       ya[i-1];
00142         }
00143 
00144         *y      =       ya[(ns--)-1];
00145         for (m = 1; m < *n; m++) {
00146                 for (i = 1; i <= *n - m; i++) {
00147                         ho      =       xa[i-1] - *x;
00148                         hp      =       xa[i+m-1] - *x;
00149                         w       =       c[i+1-1] - d[i-1];
00150                         den     =       ho - hp;
00151                         if ( den == 0.0) return;
00152                         den     =       w / den;
00153                         d[i-1]= hp * den;
00154                         c[i-1]= ho * den;
00155 
00156                 }
00157                 *y += (*dy=(2*ns < (*n-m) ? c[ns+1-1] : d[(ns--)-1]));
00158         }
00159         free(d);
00160         free(c);
00161 }
00162 
00163 void interp(float* xa, float* ya, long* n, long* n_pol, float* x, float *y, float *dy)
00164 {
00165         long    j;
00166         locate( xa,                                     // find index nearest to x
00167                         n,
00168                         x,
00169                         &j);
00170         long    k       =       LMIN(LMAX(j - (*n_pol-1) / 2, 1), *n + 1 - *n_pol);
00171         polint( &xa[k-1 -1],
00172                         &ya[k-1 -1],
00173                         n_pol,
00174                         x,
00175                         y,
00176                         dy);
00177         return;
00178 }

00180 // get LET-data for given material
00181 void getPSTARvalue(long* n, float* x, long* material_no, float* x_table, float* y_table, float* y)
00182 {
00183         // first: find those PSTAR entries that match the material name
00184         bool*           matches         =       (bool*)calloc(SGP_PSTAR_Data.n, sizeof(bool));
00185         matchi(         material_no,
00186                                 SGP_PSTAR_Data.material_no,
00187                                 &SGP_PSTAR_Data.n,
00188                                 matches);
00189 
00190         long            n_matches       = 0;
00191         long            i;
00192         for (i = 0; i < SGP_PSTAR_Data.n; i++){
00193                 if (matches[i]){n_matches++;}
00194 //              printf(debf,"idx: %i, match: %d\n",i, matches[i]);
00195         }
00196 
00197         // allocate vectors for extracted LET entries
00198         float*  x_c     =       (float*)calloc(n_matches, sizeof(float));
00199         float*  y_c     =       (float*)calloc(n_matches, sizeof(float));
00200 
00201         // and get the values
00202         long            j       = 0;
00203         for (i = 0; i < SGP_PSTAR_Data.n; i++){
00204                 if (matches[i]){
00205                         x_c[j]  = x_table[i];
00206                         y_c[j]  = y_table[i];
00207                         j++;
00208                 }
00209         }
00210         long    n_pol                   = 4 + 1;
00211         for (i = 0; i < *n; i++){
00212                 // Get proton-LET for scaled energy from table E, L using 4th degree polynomial (n_pol - 1 = 2) interpolation
00213                 float   err_y_tmp       = 0.0f;         // dummy
00214                 interp(         x_c,
00215                                         y_c,
00216                                         &n_matches,
00217                                         &n_pol,
00218                                         &x[i],
00219                                         &y[i],
00220                                         &err_y_tmp);
00221         }
00222 
00223         free(x_c);
00224         free(y_c);
00225         free(matches);
00226 }

00230 
00231 float gammln(float xx)
00232 {
00233         double x,y,tmp,ser;
00234         static double cof[6]=   {       76.18009172947146,-86.50532032941677,
00235                                                                 24.01409824083091,-1.231739572450155,
00236                                                                 0.1208650973866179e-2,-0.5395239384953e-5};
00237         int j;
00238         y=x=xx;
00239         tmp=x+5.5;
00240         tmp -= (x+0.5)*log(tmp);
00241         ser=1.000000000190015;
00242         for (j=0;j<=5;j++) ser += cof[j]/++y;
00243         return (float)(-tmp+log(2.5066282746310005*ser/x));
00244 }

00247 #define ITMAX 100
00248 #define EPS 3.0e-7
00249 #define FPMIN 1.0e-30
00250 
00251 void gcf(float *gammcf, float a, float x, float *gln)
00252 {
00253         int i;
00254         float an,b,c,d,del,h;
00255         *gln=gammln(a);
00256         b=x+1.0-a;
00257         c=1.0/FPMIN;
00258         d=1.0/b;
00259         h=d;
00260         for (i=1;i<=ITMAX;i++) {
00261                 an = -i*(i-a);
00262                 b += 2.0;
00263                 d=an*d+b;
00264                 if (fabs(d) < FPMIN) d=FPMIN;
00265                 c=b+an/c;
00266                 if (fabs(c) < FPMIN) c=FPMIN;
00267                 d=1.0/d;
00268                 del=d*c;
00269                 h *= del;
00270                 if (fabs(del-1.0) < EPS) break;
00271         }
00272 //      if (i > ITMAX) nrerror("a too large, ITMAX too small in gcf");
00273         *gammcf=exp(-x+a*log(x)-(*gln))*h;
00274 }
00275 
00276 void gser(float *gamser, float a, float x, float *gln)
00277 {
00278         int n;
00279         float sum,del,ap;
00280         *gln=gammln(a);
00281         if (x <= 0.0) {
00282                 if (x < 0.0) return;
00283                 *gamser=0.0;
00284                 return;
00285         } else {
00286         ap=a;
00287         del=sum=1.0/a;
00288         for (n=1;n<=ITMAX;n++) {
00289                 ++ap;
00290                 del *= x/ap;
00291                 sum += del;
00292                 if (fabs(del) < fabs(sum)*EPS) {
00293                         *gamser=sum*exp(-x+a*log(x)-(*gln));
00294                         return;
00295                         }
00296                 }
00297 //      nrerror("a too large, ITMAX too small in routine gser");
00298         return;
00299         }
00300 }
00301 
00302 float gammp(float a, float x)
00303 {
00304         float gamser, gammcf, gln;
00305 
00306         if (x < 0.0f || a <= 0.0f) return 0;
00307         if (x < (a + 1.0f)) {
00308                 gser(&gamser, a, x, &gln);
00309                 return gamser;
00310         } else {
00311                 gcf(&gammcf, a, x, &gln);
00312                 return 1.0f - gammcf;
00313         }
00314 }
00315 
00316 
00317 float erff(float x)
00318 {
00319         return x < 0.0f ? -gammp(0.5f, x*x) : gammp(0.5f, x*x);
00320 }

00322 void nrerror(char error_text[])
00323 /* Numerical Recipes standard error handler */
00324 {
00325         fprintf(stderr,"Numerical Recipes run-time error...\n");
00326         fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error_text);
00327         fprintf(stderr,"...now exiting to system...\n");
00328         exit(1);
00329 }

00332 #define SIGN(a,b) ((b) >= 0.0 ? fabs(a) : -fabs(a))
00333 #define MAXIT 60
00334 #define UNUSED (-1.11e30)
00335 float zriddr(float (*func)(float,void*), void * params, float x1, float x2, float xacc)
00336 /*      From Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed., 1992:
00337         Using Ridders' method, return the root of a function func known to lie between x1 and x2.
00338         The root, returned as zriddr, will be refined to an approximate accuracy xacc.
00339  */
00340 {
00341         int j;
00342         float ans,fh,fl,fm,fnew,s,xh,xl,xm,xnew;
00343         fl=(*func)(x1,params);
00344         fh=(*func)(x2,params);
00345         if ((fl > 0.0 && fh < 0.0) || (fl < 0.0 && fh > 0.0)) {
00346                 xl=x1;
00347                 xh=x2;
00348                 ans=UNUSED;                                                                                             //      Any highly unlikely value, to simplify logic below.
00349                 for (j=1;j<=MAXIT;j++) {
00350                         xm=0.5*(xl+xh);
00351                         fm=(*func)(xm,params);                                                                          // First of two function evaluations per its=
00352                         s=sqrt(fm*fm-fl*fh);                                                                    // eration.
00353                         if (s == 0.0) return ans;
00354                         xnew=xm+(xm-xl)*((fl >= fh ? 1.0 : -1.0)*fm/s);         // Updating formula.
00355                         if (fabs(xnew-ans) <= xacc) return ans;
00356                         ans=xnew;
00357                         fnew=(*func)(ans,params);                                                                       // Second of two function evaluations per
00358                         if (fnew == 0.0) return ans;                                            // iteration.
00359                         if (SIGN(fm,fnew) != fm) {                                                      // Bookkeeping to keep the root bracketed
00360                                 xl=xm;                                                                                  // on next iteration.
00361                                 fl=fm;
00362                                 xh=ans;
00363                                 fh=fnew;
00364                         } else if (SIGN(fl,fnew) != fl) {
00365                                 xh=ans;
00366                                 fh=fnew;
00367                         } else if (SIGN(fh,fnew) != fh) {
00368                                 xl=ans;
00369                                 fl=fnew;
00370                         } else nrerror("never get here.");
00371                         if (fabs(xh-xl) <= xacc) return ans;
00372                 }
00373                 nrerror("zriddr exceed maximum iterations");
00374         }
00375         else {
00376                 if (fl == 0.0) return x1;
00377                 if (fh == 0.0) return x2;
00378                 nrerror("root must be bracketed in zriddr.");
00379         }
00380         return 0.0;                                                                                             // Never get here.
00381 }
